p: It is believed that women, compared to men, are less vulnerable to viral diseases due to dissimilar innate immunity, steroid hormones and factors related to sex chromosomes. The immune regulatory genes encoded by X chromosome in female category causes lower viral load, and less inflammation than in man, while CD4+ T cells are higher with better immune response. Higher TLR7 in women and its biallelic expression is responsible for better immune responses and enhances the fighting to viral infections in comparison to men [ 47].
